intro: Antherotriche, commonly known as the "mountain bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. These plants are typically found in alpine and mountainous regions, where they thrive in cool, moist environments. Antherotriche species are characterized by their bell-shaped, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors such as blue, purple, or white. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. These plants play an important ecological role in their native habitats by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
